resources.string: Although we do not know officially how to Coronavirus began we do know that the first case was in Wuhan China in later December. The first death of this virus was on January 11th. Less than a month later the virus was spreading worldwide. With confirmed cases in countries such as the United States, Japan and more, the World Health Organization declared this virus a Pandemic. Countries are now limiting both travel and gatherings to prevent the spread of this virus. \n

Some of the signs of Covid 19 include, Fever, Cough, difficulty breathing, chills, sore throat, and muscle pain. 
 Since there is not a cure for this virus yet one should be very cautious when interacting with others. Some ways to prevent the spread of this virus is to keep a safe distance from others, keep your hands clean, cover your face and most importantly try to stay home as much as possible. 
 Provided below are links to the to websites of the WHO and the CDC.

string.name: messageWithLink2
string.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

resources.string:
It has been more than two months since the first case of the virus was found on US soil. Since then there has been major change occuring in the United States. For instance, there have been millions of people losing their job. As a result there have been over 20 million people who have filed for unemployment. One reason for why there are so many unemployed people is because since people are not buying and the econmy has been decreasing, companies can not afford to keep as many employees as before. 

 In the most recent update, President Donald Trump is allowing states to slowly reopen. The main reason for this decision is because of how negatively impacted our economy has been since the start of Covid-19. 

More information about Covid-19 is found everyday, so visit the sites below to get the most up to date information.
